welcomeMessage: Hi **@chauler**, how can I help you?

parts.text:
Context: You are an accessibility expert reviewing HTML for accessibility issues. Analyze the following code in the context of WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines) 2.2, listing any issues that may violate these guidelines. You will only be analyzing the HTML, ignoring any included or missing styles and scripts. Code: ```

Anime Paradise

  • Home
  • Latest Anime
  • Genres
  • Top Rated

Featured Anime

Genres

Character Showcase

All Anime







© 2023 Anime Paradise

``` Response format: Snippet with error: … Location of error: … WCAG Guideline violated: … Detection Algorithm: … Explanation of Error: …

message.text:
Context: You are an accessibility expert reviewing HTML for accessibility issues. Analyze the following code in the context of WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines) 2.2, listing any issues that may violate these guidelines. You will only be analyzing the HTML, ignoring any included or missing styles and scripts. Code: ```

Anime Paradise

  • Home
  • Latest Anime
  • Genres
  • Top Rated

Featured Anime

Genres

Character Showcase

All Anime







© 2023 Anime Paradise

``` Response format: Snippet with error: … Location of error: … WCAG Guideline violated: … Detection Algorithm: … Explanation of Error: …

response.value:
Snippet with error: `<label for="anime-search"></label>`
Location of error: In the header, within the search-container div.
WCAG Guideline violated: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships
Detection Algorithm: Check if all form elements have associated labels with meaningful text.
Explanation of Error: The label for the search input field is empty. It should contain descriptive text that indicates the purpose of the associated input field.

---

Snippet with error: `<section id="anime-list">`
Location of error: In the main, there are two sections with the same id "anime-list".
WCAG Guideline violated: 4.1.1 Parsing
Detection Algorithm: Check if all id attributes are unique within the document.
Explanation of Error: The id attribute must be unique within the document to ensure that elements can be programmatically determined and manipulated.

---

Snippet with error: `<input type="checkbox" id="vehicle1" name="vehicle1" value="Bike">`
Location of error: In the form, the checkbox input for "Bike" has no associated label.
WCAG Guideline violated: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships
Detection Algorithm: Check if all form elements have associated labels with meaningful text.
Explanation of Error: The checkbox input for "Bike" lacks an associated label. Each form control should have an associated label to provide a description of the control's function.

---

Snippet with error: `<label for="myfile"></label>`
Location of error: In the form, the label for the file input field is empty.
WCAG Guideline violated: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships
Detection Algorithm: Check if all form elements have associated labels with meaningful text.
Explanation of Error: The label for the file input field is empty. It should contain descriptive text that indicates the purpose of the associated input field.

followups.message: What is the purpose of the "for" attribute in HTML labels?

b.description: Ask Copilot or type / for commands

metadata.helpTextPrefix: You can ask me general programming questions, or chat with the following participants which have specialized expertise and can perform actions:
metadata.helpTextVariablesPrefix: You can also help me understand your question by using the following variables to give me extra context:

helpTextPostfix.value:
To have a great conversation, ask me questions as if I was a real programmer:

* **Show me the code** you want to talk about by having the files open and selecting the most important lines.
* **Make refinements** by asking me follow-up questions, adding clarifications, providing errors, etc.
* **Review my suggested code** and tell me about issues or improvements, so I can iterate on it.

You can also ask me questions about your editor selection by [starting an inline chat session](command:inlineChat.start).

Learn more about [GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/copilot/using-github-copilot/getting-started-with-github-copilot?tool=vscode&utm_source=editor&utm_medium=chat-panel&utm_campaign=2024q3-em-MSFT-getstarted) in [Visual Studio Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/overview).

b.name: GitHub Copilot

parts.text: Are there any more issues? List all that you find.

message.text: Are there any more issues? List all that you find.

response.value:
Snippet with error: `` Location of error: In the form, the radio inputs for "fav_number" have numeric ids. WCAG Guideline violated: 4.1.1 Parsing Detection Algorithm: Check if all id attributes are not starting with a number. Explanation of Error: The id attribute should not start with a number. It should start with a letter or underscore for compatibility with CSS and JavaScript. --- Snippet with error: `` Location of error: In the form, the password input field. WCAG Guideline violated: 3.3.2 Labels or Instructions Detection Algorithm: Check if all form elements have associated labels with meaningful text. Explanation of Error: The label for the password input field uses an abbreviation. It should use the full word "Password" to ensure it's clear and understandable. --- Snippet with error: `

Anime Paradise

` Location of error: In the header. WCAG Guideline violated: 2.4.6 Headings and Labels Detection Algorithm: Check if all headings describe the topic or purpose. Explanation of Error: The heading "Anime Paradise" is not descriptive enough. It should provide more information about the content of the page or section. --- Snippet with error: `Home` Location of error: In the navigation bar. WCAG Guideline violated: 2.4.4 Link Purpose (In Context) Detection Algorithm: Check if all links have a href attribute that navigates to a valid destination. Explanation of Error: The links in the navigation bar have a href attribute with a value of "#". This does not navigate to a valid destination and can be confusing for users. --- Snippet with error: `` Location of error: In the form. WCAG Guideline violated: 2.4.6 Headings and Labels Detection Algorithm: Check if all interactive elements have descriptive labels. Explanation of Error: The submit button's label is "Submit", which is not descriptive enough. It should indicate what will happen when the button is clicked, such as "Submit Form".

followups.message: What are some best practices for improving the accessibility of HTML forms?
